description: Dive into "Picture-Perfect Valencia: Capture the Magic" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Picture-Perfect Valencia: Capture the Magic

places.generalDescription: The Mercat Central de València is a vibrant and historic market housed in a stunning Modernista building adorned with colorful tiles. It is one of the oldest food markets in Europe, offering an authentic glimpse into daily life in Valencia. The market boasts a diverse collection of stalls, each separated by type, where locals shop for regional produce such as live eels, various prawn varieties, and giant hams.

sources.snippet: If you have not visited the Central Market yet, we do not know what you are waiting for. This huge modernist building hides in its interior a world of colors and aromas, with more than 300 stalls of fresh products… a paradise for foodies and photo lovers!
sources.shortName: Using the Valencia filter in Valencia: top 10 Instagram spots in the city

sources.snippet: Another famous place and a  perfect photo spot in Valencia is the Central Market, or as the locals call it “Mercato Central”. Always busy but worth to be visited, this market is a mix of Restaurants, Bar and a shopping centre.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Spots In Valencia, Spain (With Map)

sources.snippet: Valencian cuisine has many things to boast about and you can find them all at the Central Market, the biggest market with fresh produce in Europe full of Mediterranean flavours and aromas.
sources.shortName: Valencia Tourist Attractions | Things to see in Valencia

sources.siteName: DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC > My very personal Travel Blog on Valencia by María Tortajada <
sources.shortName: The 15 most Instagrammable places in Valencia, Spain | DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC

places.name: Central Market of Valencia

reviews.text:
A functional place where you can find everything in terms of food and drink. I love marketplaces.
In this mercado, you can get a single serving of paella in plastic containers from the stalls inside. When in Valencia, having paella is a must. A portion costs around 5–6 euros. I had the original chicken version - with saffron and its special rice, it was an excellent taste. Definitely try it. I can't say anything about the seafood version because I didn't dare to try it :)

This is a spectacular market situated right in the centre of town offering food, fruits, meats, dried fruits & nuts and lot more especially the various varieties of freshly cooked Paella!
The place is very clean, well looked after and well managed.

Beautiful market hall with lots of variety. Mostly food, but also some souvenirs. The atmosphere is lively and the building itself is stunning. It was quite warm inside, so I hesitated to try the meat, but still a great place to visit!

places.generalDescription: The Ciudad de las Artes y las Ciencias is a cutting-edge science complex located in a beautifully landscaped park. It features a large aquarium, an IMAX cinema, and various cultural and scientific institutions.

sources.snippet: And, of course, last but not least, we cannot end this post without mentioning probably the most popular attraction of Valencia: the City of Arts and Sciences, where you’ll get amazing bluish and modern shots!
sources.shortName: The 10 most Instagrammable spots in Valencia | by Uniplaces team

places.name: Ciudad de las Artes y las Ciencias

reviews.text: This place was extremely gorgeous. It is such a nice place to take pictures outside! The museum itself has so much to learn about, and has surveys you can take to help improve it. We had a great time and would've spent longer had we had more time. I recommend buying tickets to the Hemisphere show as well. We saw the Amazon show and it was great. We even saw baby chicks hatch inside!!!

The architecture is amazing and is covered in nature. You can even see and hear parrots in the trees and it's beautiful. It's a brilliant place to walk around and explore but one thing which wasn't the best was the cost to go inside. I read other reviews and some people said how it isn't worth paying the money to go inside and I can agree with them. If you want to, your more than welcome to pay the money to go inside but I wouldn't. Overall, amazing place to go and there's a bus which goes right up to the museum which was very helpful.

We did the whole Combination, Museum, Cinema and the Oceanographic Park! Booked a combined ticket in advance which I would recommend! The Museum is a must for every person that's interested in science/ the human body!
We are two medstudents and we loved it but it's definitely something children would love as well! The Movie is just an experience for the eyes, the big round screen is unique and therefore very interesting!
The Seaanimals are very nice to watch. However, might be the case that they have multiple certifications but to have beluga whales in an Aquarium and Dolphines for a show, even if it isn't as disciplined as some other shows, isn't really acceptable. We on purpose didn't go to the show and we read afterwards some articles which stated the show is very dolphins friendly and the circumstances are far from shows at Seaworld etc. but we heard the crowd from far and Dolphines are very intelligent and sensitive animals which is why that's not acceptable. Just because they don't treat the Dolphines as cruel as others, doesn't mean it's not cruel.
And to keep them and even bigger animals, belugas, in a tank of water when normally they would wander thousands of miles in the ocean just makes me very sad.
And I am aware, that they also support the ecosystem sea in a way but I would like to see at least no Dolphines and Whales in Tanks way to small for their needs.

We won't be coming back, I wouldn't necessarily recommend anyone going there. The only case I would go back is probably with kids, for educational purposes.

However, still 3 Stars for the Cinema and the Museum.

places.generalDescription: Bioparc Valencia is a unique zoo that houses nearly a thousand animals from 150 different African species. The park features specially designed habitats to ensure the well-being and comfort of the animals, offering visitors an immersive experience in various natural habitats. From vast savannas to dense forests, visitors can observe antelopes, giraffes, rhinoceroses, hyenas, buffaloes, leopards, gorillas, and elephants in recreated wild environments.

sources.snippet: Here you can learn about the most outstanding animals, vegetation, and landscapes found in the neighbouring continent's habitats: the savannah, the forests of Equatorial Africa and Madagascar, and the wetlands.
sources.shortName: Valencia Tourist Attractions | Things to see in Valencia

places.name: Bioparc Valencia

reviews.text:
The best zoo I have every been! I spent a whole day just walking and enjoying animals. The whole park is very good planned, animals are close like lemurs hanging over heads. There is a lot of places to seat and rest and just watch animals playing or making their daily activities. The zoo imitates the natural habitat of animals, there is a lot of caves, waterfalls, animals are not separated in caves or an limited area, so it's such a great experience to see them together and happy.

I highly recommend to buy tickets online to skip the queue. Also there is one restaurant, for menu of day (19 euro) you can have a soup, main dish, dessert and drinks. The restaurant has a beautiful terrace so you can eat watching animals.

Definitely I will come back!

So much fun! Only £25 each for adults. Purchased online the day before and didn't have to line up like the rest. Able to just walk in. The enclosures were so nicely done, clean and the animals appeared well looked after. Would recommend the hippo feeding which is free to watch. The bird show is something I wouldn't rave about and if you're short on time give it a miss. Otherwise so fun. They have an open enclosure where the lemurs reside.

It was the best zoo I even been too. The major reason is the respect they provided for the animals . You can feel that they were happy. The staff can speak English . Highly recommend the restaurant then you can just having your meal with giraffes, rhino etc … and the meal set is 19.9 with starter ( salad / soup), main , desert / fruit and , drink. What a nice atmosphere with such a price. I love that they didn't overcharge like other theme park ! And they have a lot of animals too Thanks for having me !

places.address: Av. Pío Baroja, 3, Campanar, 46015 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Serranos Towers, an imposing pair of Gothic-style towers, are remnants of Valencia's ancient city walls. Originally built for defense, they now offer panoramic views of the city and the river. The surrounding area is perfect for exploring on foot, with attractions like Plaza de la Reina, the Cathedral and Miguelete tower offering beautiful vistas after climbing 207 steps.

sources.snippet: Torres de Serranos or the Serrans Gate is one of the most popular Valencia tourist sites. It is one of the original twelve gates that allowed entry though Valencia’s ancient city wall. Of all the places to see in Valencia, this gate is the most well preserved monument.
sources.shortName: 14 Instagram Worthy Beautiful Places in Valencia

sources.snippet: The Serranos Towers is another one of those spots you can easily see whilst strolling through Valencia, especially if you’ve just been to the Institue of Modern Art (that’s totally amazing and nearby).
sources.shortName: 18 Best Things To Do In Valencia, Spain

places.name: Torres de Serranos

reviews.text: Great view of the city and fun little stop on your trip through Valencia. Considering the amount of tourists in the city we decided to do this at opening 10:00 to beat the crowd and that would definitely be my recommendation. It's €2 to get in and a great little stop

Nice landmark towers with good views. Free on Sunday when we visited.
Be prepared to climb quite a few steps, but you can stop off at 2 levels and walk around, as you ascend.
The Torres de Serranos were one of two gates, in the old city walls.
Allow about an hour to visit. Plenty of bars and cafes nearby.

Very cheap, so it's worth the price for some views and pics. No much to see though.

I don't recommend if you're afraid of heights, and some parts don't offer much protection.

places.address: C. de la Blanqueria, 1, Ciutat Vella, 46003 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Mercat de Colón, a historic market housed in a stunning modernist building dating back to 1916, has been transformed into a vibrant dining and shopping destination. Situated in the Eixample district of Valencia, it offers an array of fresh produce stalls as well as diverse restaurants and bars. Visitors can savor an authentic organic horchata breakfast at Casa Orxata while enjoying the market's architectural splendor.

sources.snippet: Perched in the old quarter of Valencia, you kinda can’t miss Plaza de la Virgen. You see, it’s surrounded by some of the iconic buildings I’ve already mentioned and really easy to see after visiting the nearby cathedral and climbing Torre del Micalet.
sources.shortName: 18 Best Things To Do In Valencia, Spain

places.name: Mercado de Colón

reviews.text: This is a small market with two stories and parking below with elevator access. It is filled with many places to eat, including options such as horchata and dipping bread, coffee, gelato, sweet pastries, Japanese food, a full bar with a unique eclectic vibe, and on the second floor below ground level, there is a cheese and meat shop that also offers bottles of wine for sale. We went on a Monday around 7:30pm and many places were closed inside. Some of the restaurants are enclosed, and others offer open air seating. There aren't any actual retail shops, it is more of an eatery and small market. Very cute though and worth a walk.

It's more limited compared to the typical mercados in Spain. You can eat, drink, and shop inside, but there are fewer options. Don't expect the crowds or variety you'd find in other mercados. It has a calmer atmosphere. The building is very beautiful.

Absolutely beautiful market! Mercado de Colón in Valencia is a stunning place with great architecture and a lively atmosphere. There are plenty of options for delicious snacks and tapas. We enjoyed two beers here while soaking in the relaxed vibe. It's the perfect spot to take a break, people-watch, and taste local flavors. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Valencia!

places.address: Carrer de Jorge Juan, 19, L'Eixample, 46004 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Oceanogràfic is a major attraction located within the City of Arts and Sciences in Valencia, Spain. It is Europe's largest marine park, featuring over 20,000 creatures from 650 different species. The aquarium showcases marine life from various ecosystems around the world, offering visitors an immersive experience through its diverse exhibits.

sources.snippet: Part of the City of Arts and Sciences, the Oceanogràfic is Europe’s largest aquarium. Its distinctive glass buildings and marine life exhibits offer plenty of Instagram-worthy opportunities. Capture the dramatic architecture or snap a photo with trees and animals.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Valencia

sources.snippet: Europe's largest aquarium: 500 marine species represented by a whopping 45,000 specimens from the most important ecosystems of each of the Earth's seas and oceans. A real tribute to marine life, with a dolphinarium and bio-educational displays.
sources.shortName: Valencia Tourist Attractions | Things to see in Valencia

places.name: Oceanogràfic València

reviews.text: Beautiful place, with a lot of attractions for both children and adults. I would highly recommend the dolphin representations, absolutely lovely. Place is well organised, and varied in expositions, you can easily spend an entire day and not become bored. Foods and drinks available throughout the complex. There are also souvenir shops with many items you can choose from. There are also options to combine tickets with visit to the Museum of Sciences or Hemispheric Projections. During busy periods, might be recommended to get tickets in advance

Initially we thought it was expensive for entry but I had heard it was very good and wasn't disappointed. The whole experience is excellent. The marine life and conservation projects are first class. Easy access to all areas for wheelchair users and pushchairs, plenty of clean toilets and cafes. The dolphin show is included in the price and is really good. We had a thoroughly good half a day but I am sure if you had children you'd stay longer.

Fabulous, a most enjoyable experience.
Informative and wondrous. It was busy so booking online saved a wait in line.
Paid for the audio guides but barely used them as the written information was very comprehensive.
Had lovely food available for most dietary requirements. Certainly, the flamingo restaurant/ cafe had great some vegan options.
The shark tank was incredible, dolphin show spectacular and the 4D cinema was short but fun.

places.address: C/ d'Eduardo Primo Yúfera, 1, Quatre Carreres, 46013 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: The Museum of Fine Arts of Valencia, housed in an impressive 17th-century building, is a treasure trove of Valencian and Flemish art collections. Founded in 1913, the museum boasts around 2,000 artworks from the 14th to 17th centuries by renowned artists like Diego Velazquez, El Greco, Goya, Gonzalo Perez, and Pinturicchio.

sources.snippet: As the name suggests, this is a museum, but we mostly went there for this cute courtyard. It’s pink and there are some plants and stuff there as well. Surprisingly, there was no entrance fee – and the courtyard was empty for the most part.
sources.shortName: Most Instagrammable Places in Valencia

places.name: Museo de Bellas Artes de Valencia

reviews.text: You definitely need to visit this museum during your stay in Valencia. You can discover hundreds of works by famous painters, including the likes of Goya, Van Dyck and Velázquez. No entry fee!

A beautiful museum with an extensive collection of artworks. I visited at 6 PM, and there were hardly any people, making for a peaceful experience. Entry is free, which makes it even more accessible.

I spent about an hour exploring the permanent exhibition, followed by another 30 minutes for the two temporary exhibitions. The selection of paintings was truly impressive, and I thoroughly enjoyed them.

The museum was such a pleasant surprise! It's bigger than I expected and has a wonderful collection. Lots of religious art and paintings, but also many other impressive works. Even better, the entrance is free, which I think is such a great and generous thing.

Beyond the art, it's also just a really nice place to spend some time. The air conditioning was a relief from the Spanish heat. There's a small cafeteria with vending machines where you can grab a snack or drink for a reasonable price and take a break. The garden outside is also beautiful and perfect for sitting down for a moment.

The overall atmosphere was very welcoming, with friendly staff and security. This museum definitely exceeded my expectations, and I would happily visit again!

places.address: C/ de Sant Pius V, 9, La Saïdia, 46010 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: El Micalet, also known as El Miguelete, is the Gothic-style octagonal bell tower of the Valencia Cathedral. Standing at 70 meters tall, it offers breathtaking panoramic views of the city from its top. Visitors can climb the tower using a spiral staircase with 207 steps and admire the stunning architecture of the historic center along with enjoying a bird's eye view of Valencia.

sources.snippet: Starting in the heart of the city, you will find that every building in Valencia is indeed Instagram-worthy. Being an architecture lover like myself, I couldn’t take my eyes off the intricate details of each facade. The Valencia Cathedral, located in the historic center, is a stunning blend of Gothic, Romanesque, and Baroque styles.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Valencia

sources.snippet: After visiting El Carmen, you are nearby El Micalet, the octagonal bell tower of the cathedral. This is one of the most visited monuments of the city and has been connected to the cathedral since the 15th century. The most beautiful pictures are taken after climbing more than 200 steps, at the top of the tower.
sources.shortName: Photography spots

places.name: El Micalet

reviews.text:
Iconic building is a must visit if you are in Valencia.

The entry fee was quite reasonable just 9 EUR for me. With this you get access to the church and museum, however tower requires a separate ticket which can only be paid by cash.

The included audio guide is quite comprehensive and covers not just history of the building but many of religious backgrounds for each area that will be explored during this fine.

The highlight for me was the cup that Jesus himself drank from, a one of a kind relic!

3 euro entrance to the cathedral tower. Quite crowded the rooftop and there are plenty of stairs to climb, beautiful view on the city and a good coordination with traffic lights for climbing and descending. I got scared when the bell started to bang, cool to see it functioning, though.

The tower of the Valencia Cathedral is visited separately and for the ticket you need cash. The entrance is 2.5€. Also opens earlier than the cathedral. We visited at 8 AM.
If you are not used with effort will be a real challenge - 207 steps. The last part of the climbing is tighter and steps are smaller. You have a traffic light at the top so you won't go down while others go up on that portion.
The view is amazing.

places.address: Pça. de la Reina, s/n, Ciutat Vella, 46001 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: La Lonja de la Seda de Valencia, also known as the Silk Exchange, is a grandiose building that showcases the city's Medieval wealth through intricate stonework and carvings. It was once a symbol of Valencia's power during its economic boom in the 14th to 16th centuries due to silk production. The Merchant's Hall within the building is considered a magnificent jewel with its unique design featuring columns resembling palm trees and a ceiling meant to evoke a starry sky.

sources.snippet: La Lonja is a UNESCO World Heritage site and is one of the most beautiful places I’ve seen in my life. For dramatic and awe-inspiring interior shots, step into the Columned Hall and take photos among the twisted columns and vaulted ceilings. Then, step outside for stunning photos in the serene courtyard filled with orange trees.
sources.shortName: The Most Instagrammable Places in Valencia

places.name: La Lonja de la Seda de Valencia

reviews.text: A beautiful UNESCO world heritage site in the centre of València. Very helpful staff and considering its UNESCO - there was no queues and no waiting times. We were given the option of an audio guide which we took. Very easy audio equipment to use, including the map, which directs you from around the building and even brings you on the outside of the building too! Would definitely recommend to spend an hour here.

A fascinating structure and unique interior architecture especially the columns in the main hall that support the floor. The ancient trading place mainly for the Silk trading auction and meetings is a great place to visit. The courtyard houses rare plants and orange trees with with seating to relax and enjoy the view.

This place is a piece of history! The architecture is amazing, especially those impressive columns and the ceiling in the big hall. We spent about an hour just wandering around, watching the presentation on the history of this place. It's definitely worth checking out!

places.address: C/ de la Llotja, 2, Ciutat Vella, 46001 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: La Marina de València has become an iconic site in the city, featuring trendy restaurants and bars by the sea, offering activities throughout the day. It's a highly recommended place for year-round strolls, with festivals and concerts adding to its vibrant atmosphere. The area boasts a beautiful and expansive promenade with a skating rink for all ages, children's play areas, sailing excursions, and even spaces where people gather to dance to their own music.

sources.snippet: Next to the Malvarrosa, we will find several Instagram spots that we can not miss, so I will group them under the «La Marina» point, to encourage you to visit both the modern and the oldest part of the port area and, of course, the best known beach in Valencia, the Malvarrosa Beach.
sources.siteName: DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC > My very personal Travel Blog on Valencia by María Tortajada <
sources.shortName: The 15 most Instagrammable places in Valencia, Spain | DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC

sources.snippet: This place is perfect for a stroll, a drink and an incredible shot!. If you’re into the blue colours, go during the day and a love a sunset palette, do not hesitate to visit this area during sunrise or sunset. You’ll be amazed by the colours and its reflection into the water!
sources.shortName: The 10 most Instagrammable spots in Valencia | by Uniplaces team

sources.snippet: Enjoy in your own style miles and miles of distinguished beaches with blue flags. Relax by contemplating the sea from one of the many restaurants on the promenade or from the avant-garde Veles e Vents de la Marina building.
sources.shortName: Valencia Tourist Attractions | Things to see in Valencia

places.name: La Marina de Valencia

reviews.text:
Our journey from Antalya to Valencia turned into a true sailing adventure. We took our time, making stops along the way to enjoy the Mediterranean ports. We visited the Greek islands, cruised along the Italian coast, spent some time in the Balearics, and only then set course for Valencia. In total, the voyage took us about three weeks, but every stop was absolutely worth it.
When we finally arrived at La Marina de Valencia, we were immediately impressed by its scale. The marina is spacious, well-organized, and provides great protection from waves and strong winds. The staff was efficient-they met us at the entrance, helped with mooring, and provided all the necessary information.
For a long-term stay, this marina is incredibly convenient. It offers electricity, water, 24/7 security, showers, laundry, a service area for maintenance, as well as shops, restaurants, and even sports facilities. The city center is just a short ride away, and the nearby beaches are within walking distance.
We stayed here for two weeks, taking care of the boat, relaxing, and exploring the city. Valencia is vibrant and full of character, with a charming old town, modern districts, and amazing local cuisine. There were also plenty of activities right in the marina-windsurfing, seaside walks, and even regattas in the bay.
The weather was mostly pleasant, though we did experience a couple of windy days, which made us appreciate the marina's excellent shelter. Mooring remained comfortable even in rougher conditions.
Overall, La Marina de Valencia left us with the best impressions. It's a fantastic spot for a long stay after a major crossing, with top-notch facilities and a perfect location. If we sail through the Mediterranean again, Valencia will definitely be on our list of stops!

The marina is beautiful, located at the end of a canal with plenty of space for easy maneuvering and docking at the central pier. Docking assistance is prompt, professional, and very helpful-truly excellent service. The pier also features a welcoming area for crews to relax. Nearby, there's a lovely promenade that leads to a beachside avenue full of lively bars and restaurants-perfect for a pleasant stroll. While a taxi is needed to reach the city center, they are readily available and reasonably priced. Overall, it was a fantastic experience with great value for money. I'll be happy to return soon!

the marina of valencia is a great place, especially with the weather getting warmer. you can watch beautiful sunsets sitting by the water. there are loads of people doing sports stuff or just chilling. you can also go to the platform of the big building to get a higher viewpoint, its publicly accessible!!

places.address: Carrer del Moll de la Duana, s/n, Poblats Marítims, 46024 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Located in Alboraya, just north of Valencia, Platja de la Patacona is a quieter alternative to the bustling beaches of Malvarrosa and Las Arenas. Despite its distance from the city center, it remains easily accessible and offers a sense of spaciousness. The beach's location away from the port contributes to cleaner waters. Additionally, this area features accommodations with modern amenities such as free WiFi and access to a garden with an outdoor pool.

sources.snippet: Playa de la Patacona is a gorgeous beach located in Valencia. There is no entrance fee, but for a small price you can rent lounge chairs. This beach is perfect for spending a day in the sun, and there are plenty of restaurants nearby if you get hungry.
sources.shortName: 10 Instagrammable Places in Valencia, Spain

sources.snippet: Playa de la Patacona is one of the best beaches in Valencia. The beach is free to enter. For a small fee (few euros) you can rent lounge chairs.
sources.shortName: 14 Instagram Worthy Beautiful Places in Valencia

places.name: Platja de la Patacona

reviews.text: It is one of my favourite beach spots in the world. It's the closest Spanish version of Malibu Beach. It was calm and peaceful from September to May and hectic and packed from June to August. You have some excellent paella restaurants on the beach walk, and during the summer season, you get to enjoy “Chiringitos” on the beach.
One of the best beaches in Valencia. It's simply the better, water quality and

The water is contaminated, but the authorities don't say it to the visitors of Patacona Playa. At the end of Patacona there is a red flag and signs, even a tape of Policia local. A few meters next to the flag is a surf station and people
are jumping into the water. This is absolutely irresponsible.

places.address: Passeig Marítim de la Patacona, 51, 46120 Alboraia, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the vibrant heart of Valencia's historic district, Plaza de la Virgen is a delightful square steeped in history that dates back to Roman times. This charming spot offers a serene escape from the city's lively pace, surrounded by stunning architecture including the Cathedral of Santa Maria and the Basilica de la Virgen de los Desamparados. With its inviting cafes and outdoor terraces, it's an ideal place to savor traditional Valencian dishes while soaking up breathtaking views of iconic landmarks.

sources.snippet: The Valencia Cathedral and the Basilica de la Virgen de los Desamparados provide a stunning backdrop for your photos. Don’t forget to visit during the annual Las Fallas festival for incredible scenes.
sources.shortName: 8 Most Instagrammable Spots In Valencia, Spain
Most Instagrammable Spots In Valencia, Spain (With Map)

sources.siteName: DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC > My very personal Travel Blog on Valencia by María Tortajada <
sources.shortName: The 15 most Instagrammable places in Valencia, Spain | DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC
10 Instagrammable Places in Valencia, Spain

places.name: Plaza de la Virgen

reviews.text: One of the most visited and busiest squares in the old town Valencia. This is also a very unique square with a big fountain and where back entrance of the cathedral meet. All the old town main streets will start from this square. From here you can get to any area of the old downtown. A few restaurants in the square and terrazas where you can enjoy a beverage and the scenery and the architecture.
One of the beautiful places in Valencia. Check on YouTube how it looks like in March on Fallas. Search "Plaza de la Virgen. Valencia 20.03.2023 4K"  @travel.to.valencia

One of Valencia's most charming squares, full of history and life. Surrounded by beautiful architecture, including the cathedral and Turia Fountain, it's a great place to relax, take photos, and soak in the city's atmosphere.

places.address: Plaça de la Mare de Déu, Ciutat Vella, 46003 València, Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Located in the heart of Valencia's Carme neighborhood, Centre del Carme Cultura Contemporània (CCCC) is a vibrant cultural hub housed in a former 13th-century convent. Since its establishment in 2017, this historic site has been transformed into a dynamic space that showcases a diverse range of artistic expressions. The center's program encompasses various forms of contemporary art, including visual arts, experimental performances, sound installations, and design exhibitions.

sources.siteName: DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC > My very personal Travel Blog on Valencia by María Tortajada <
sources.shortName: The 15 most Instagrammable places in Valencia, Spain | DESTINATION VALENCIA VLC

places.name: CCCC (Centro del Carmen de Cultura Contemporánea)

reviews.text: Great Free museum. When I went there was a history of some of the street artists of the area and it was a fabulous exhibit. The the building itself is quite nice and worth a walk through just to see what's exhibiting while you're there.

We've been there in August. A really nice exhibition place. The building itself is truly beautiful, saw some people enjoying reading in the inner yard.
Exhibitions were nice, still some parts seemed to be closed or under construction. I liked how the organisation tries to present local artists. Also the entrance is free.

My favorite place in Valencia! A true oasis of calm and relaxation. Captivating exhibitions that never fail to inspire. The atmosphere is serene, and the welcoming staff, always smiling, made our visit a pleasure. A perfect spot to unwind and soak in creativity.
And it's also free, which makes it even better.

places.address: C/ del Museu, 2, 4, Ciutat Vella, 46003 Valencia, Spain

places.generalDescription: Veles e Vents, also known as the America's Cup Building, is a modern architectural marvel in Valencia. Designed by architects David Chipperfield and studio b720, this striking structure with white painted steel cladding and Brazilian timber decks has become a symbol of the city's cultural and architectural prowess since its inauguration in 2006. Situated next to the marina, it offers stunning views of the harbor and is now a multipurpose event space known for its gastronomy and culture.

sources.snippet: Building Veles e Vents It is a very characteristic building that is in the port of Valencia. With its avant-garde design and prime location on the coast, this building has become one of the best places to take photos in Valencia. Its modern lines are combined with the charm of sea ​​and boats.
sources.shortName: The 6 most photogenic places in Valencia for your Instagram

places.name: Veles e Vents

reviews.text: Great views! Music and staff could be better though. Definitely go if the Bakalao party is happening there, it was amazing!!

A great location with a great view. It can be a bit windy, so be prepared for that with clothing. The only surprise is that when giving a presentation, they weren't prepared that you needed a laptop on stage (on an IT conference). They resolved it with a long cable and everything was fine.
Fantastic experience at Vel y Vents, Port Valencia, amazing atmosphere, excellent service, and breathtaking views

places.address: Edificio Veles e Vents La Marina de València, Poblats Marítims, 46024 València, Valencia, Spain
